html: He shall not cry…nor cause his voice to be heard in the street. Biblical commentators Keil and Delitzsch write concerning this phrase: "Although [the Lord] is certain of His divine call, and brings to the nations the highest and best, His manner of appearing is nevertheless quiet, gentle, and humble; the very opposite of those lying teachers, who endeavored to exalt themselves by noisy demonstrations. He does not seek His own, and therefore denies Himself; He brings what commends itself, and therefore requires no forced trumpeting."
